From the base of peran; properly, through, i.e. Around; figuratively with respect to; used in various applications, of place, cause or time.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
And, even, also, namely.

27.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
27.str2: To remain, abide, stay, wait; with acc: I wait for, await. A primary verb; to stay.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

27.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
27.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
According to the manner in which, in the degree that, just as, as. From kata and hos; just as, that.

27.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Plural
27.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

27.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
27.str2: To teach, direct, admonish. A prolonged form of a primary verb dao; to teach.

28.str2: A primary particle of present time; 'now'; also as noun or adjective present or immediate.
A little child. Diminutive of teknon; an infant, i.e. darlings.

28.parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
28.str2: To remain, abide, stay, wait; with acc: I wait for, await. A primary verb; to stay.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

28.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
28.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.
If. From ei and an; a conditional particle; in case that, provided, etc.

28.parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Passive - 3rd Person Singular
28.str2: To make clear (visible, manifest), make known. From phaneros; to render apparent.

28.parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 1st Person Plural
28.str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
From pas and a derivative of rheo; all out-spokenness, i.e. Frankness, bluntness, publicity; by implication, assurance.

28.parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Passive - 1st Person Plural
28.str2: To be ashamed, be put to shame. From aischos; to feel shame.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.

28.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
28.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

28.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
28.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From the present participle of pareimi; a being near, i.e. Advent; physically, aspect.

29.str2: If. From ei and an; a conditional particle; in case that, provided, etc.

29.parse: Verb - Perfect Subjunctive Active - 2nd Person Plural

29.str2: Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

29.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
29.str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
From dike; equitable; by implication, innocent, holy.

29.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
29.str2: A prolonged form of a primary verb; to 'know' in a great variety of applications and with many implications.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

29.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
29.str2: (a) I make, manufacture, construct, (b) I do, act, cause. Apparently a prolonged form of an obsolete primary; to make or do.

29.parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
29.str2: From a variation of genos; to procreate; figuratively, to regenerate.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.

29.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
29.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
